creator: rodney.cheater@dsto.defence.gov.au
text:
I'm trying to use <exclude name="./*.zip"/> to prevent the zip task from trying 
to zip up the target file.

creator: rodney.cheater@dsto.defence.gov.au
text: Yes. However I am actually using ${zip}/*.zip where zip is set to .

creator: stevel@apache.org
text:
ok, and are you setting property zip using
<property name="zip" value="."> or 
<property name="zip" location="."/>

The exclude is relative to the fileset directory
so in all cases the correct thing to use
is <exclude name="*.zip"/>
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com

text:
./*.zip is a valid relative path. How is it I am not able to use it in this 
instance?
creator: rodney.cheater@dsto.defence.gov.au
peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
I meant relative in terms of the fileset/pattern type (not filessystem relative)
see:
http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTypes/fileset.html

creator: rodney.cheater@dsto.defence.gov.au
text:
Okay. Patternsets do not take relative directories - just "patterns". What's my 
workaround then? How can I exclude a file in the form of ${zip}/*.zip when 
${zip} can be set to "."?

Just use <exclude name="*.zip"/>
example:
<project default="zip">
  <target name="zip">
    <zip destfile="x.zip" basedir=".">
      <exclude name="*.zip"/>
    </zip>
  </target>
</project>

Peter
creator: peter.reilly@corvil.com
